channel.title: Country's where rsps are played
channel.description:
Hello,
I'm just wondering where the most rsps players come from?
I'm from The Netherlands, but for my site I need to know which languages I should add ;)

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

excluding english, a lot of people from my old private server spoke dutch. hardly saw any other language.

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:26, topic:545465”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=664345.msg4441388#msg4441388 date=1406755524]
You don’t need Spanish for RSPS.
[/quote]Si es necesario, aun que no lo creas yo soy Mexicano y tengo muchos amigos que juegan rsps[/quote]And you speak English. Hardly anyone plays RS that doesn’t speak English or one of the languages that RS was originally translated to for their worlds. And I’m pretty sure those were originally French and German.

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby

@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:21, topic:545465”]This has nothing to do with how many people speak each language, it’s based on how many people play RSPS (which we can assume is derived from who plays RS). The fact you pointed out that Spanish has more native speakers when everyone knows RS has always been a primarily English game just shows how irrelevant global language statistics are for this. Honestly, considering every RSPS forum is English you probably don’t need to translate your server at all. The people that find RSPS pretty much always speak decent English anyway. If you do want to translate it though, I would put Spanish not even close to the top of the list.

http://www.google.com/trends/explore#q=runescape&cmpt=geo[/quote]
Based on that you should definitely add Finnish.

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Death Style:

there are more than 360m native speakers of english considering the u.s. population is around 314m

Not all of US’ population are native speakers.

Try check if someone actually want any other languages (Mandarin and Spanish) and translate it if people actually care, and not bother if there is no one interested. And when I talk about people who want it, I mean NON-English speakers. No point translating it for people who speak English.

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

This has nothing to do with how many people speak each language, it’s based on how many people play RSPS (which we can assume is derived from who plays RS). The fact you pointed out that Spanish has more native speakers when everyone knows RS has always been a primarily English game just shows how irrelevant global language statistics are for this. Honestly, considering every RSPS forum is English you probably don’t need to translate your server at all. The people that find RSPS pretty much always speak decent English anyway. If you do want to translate it though, I would put Spanish not even close to the top of the list.

http://www.google.com/trends/explore#q=runescape&cmpt=geo

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Davidi2:

You don’t need Spanish for RSPS.

Spanish has 405,000,000 native speakers and is fairly easy to understand if you have a knowledge of Portuguese (trust me). English only has 360,000,000 native speakers, German only has 89,000,000 and French has even less with 74,000,000 native speakers.

There aren’t too many different messages in an RSPS and so translating it to Spanish would be well worth the benefits, especially if you’re even considering adding French.

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You don’t need Spanish for RSPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:545465”]Don’t use Google translate. As said, have pretranslated strings stored somewhere with identifiers and the when you access the string just check for the players language. This is how Jagex does it and how most sites do it as well. This allows you to fix incorrect translations without having to wait for google to fix the translator.

As for the actual languages you should add, stick with English. Then if you have the resources do french and german. That’s pretty much it.[/quote]

Spanish!!

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Don’t use Google translate. As said, have pretranslated strings stored somewhere with identifiers and the when you access the string just check for the players language. This is how Jagex does it and how most sites do it as well. This allows you to fix incorrect translations without having to wait for google to fix the translator.

As for the actual languages you should add, stick with English. Then if you have the resources do french and german. That’s pretty much it.

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:14, topic:545465”]http://www.england.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/sec-b-cond-1415.pdf

[quote]A failure by the Provider to comply with Service Condition 3.1 will be excused if it is directly attributable to or caused by an act or omission of a Commissioner, but will not be excused if the failure was caused primarily by an increase in Referrals.

A failure by the Provider to comply with Service Condition 3.1 will be excused if it is directly attributable to or caused by an act or omission of a Commissioner, but will not be excused if the failure was caused primarily by an increase in Referrals, which will include Activity due to an increased use of 999 or any other emergency telephone numbers.

The Parties must at all times act in good faith towards each other and in the performance of their respective obligations under this Contract.

The Parties must co-operate in accordance with the Law and Good Practice to facilitate the delivery of the Services in accordance with this Contract, having regard at all times to the welfare and rights of Service Users.[/quote]

[quote]Un fallo por parte del Proveedor para cumplir con servicio Condición 3.1 será justificada si se puede atribuir directamente o causado por un acto u omisión de un Comisario, pero no será justificada si el fracaso se debió principalmente a un aumento en las referencias.

Un fallo por parte del Proveedor para cumplir con servicio Condición 3.1 será justificada si se puede atribuir directamente o causado por un acto u omisión de un Comisario, pero no será justificada si el fracaso se debió principalmente a un aumento en las referencias, que se incluir la actividad debido a un mayor uso de los 999 o cualquier otro número de teléfono de emergencia.

Las Partes deben actuar en todo momento de buena fe hacia la otra y en el cumplimiento de sus respectivas obligaciones en virtud del presente Contrato.

Las Partes deberán cooperar de conformidad con la Ley y buenas prácticas para facilitar la prestación de los Servicios de conformidad con este Contrato, teniendo en cuenta en todo momento el bienestar y los derechos de los usuarios del servicio.[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

The translation from English to Norwegian is terrible. I fails to use correct capitalization and translate English synonyms into Norwegian. For some reason, the Spanish-Norwegian translation is better. Still, it shows that even formal language isn’t perfect to translate.
,

En unnlatelse av leverandøren for å overholde service Tilstand 3.1 vil bli fritatt hvis det er direkte knyttet til eller forårsaket av en handling eller unnlatelse av en kommissær, men vil ikke bli fritatt dersom feilen skyldtes først og fremst av en økning i antall henvisninger.

En unnlatelse av leverandøren for å overholde service Tilstand 3.1 vil bli fritatt hvis det er direkte knyttet til eller forårsaket av en handling eller unnlatelse av en kommissær, men vil ikke bli fritatt dersom feilen skyldtes først og fremst av en økning i henvisninger, noe som vil inkludere aktivitet på grunn av økt bruk av 999 eller andre nødtelefonnumrene.

Partene skal til enhver tid opptre i god tro mot hverandre og i utførelsen av sine respektive forpliktelser under denne Kontrakten.

Partene skal samarbeide i samsvar med lov og god praksis for å lette levering av Tjenestene i samsvar med denne avtalen, idet det tas hensyn til alle tider til velferd og rettigheter for bruk Brukere.

Read full topic

A failure by the Provider to comply with Service Condition 3.1 will be excused if it is directly attributable to or caused by an act or omission of a Commissioner, but will not be excused if the failure was caused primarily by an increase in Referrals, which will include Activity due to an increased use of 999 or any other emergency telephone numbers.

Las Partes deben actuar en todo momento de buena fe hacia la otra y en el cumplimiento de sus respectivas obligaciones en virtud del presente Contrato.

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:12, topic:545465”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664345.msg4441271#msg4441271 date=1406711801]

Someone should hook into Google translate for their chat messages

Google translate is not reliable. While it is good and generally can be correct. It won’t always be, and direct translations can easily be ruined.
[/quote]

Yeah. It’s fine for translating formal documents because they’re worded petfectly. Trying to translate informal, colloquial chat is another matter and will not work.[/quote]
That is not true. Link to some formal English document and I will show you flaws in the translation.

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:6, topic:545465”]Here’s how it works with a SAMP server I worked on a while back.

You send the string like this:

player.sendMessage("Hello"); player.sendMessage("Welcome to Lumbridge Castle, the home of Duke Horacio.");

then in sendMessage you will have something like this:

public void sendMessage(String message) { if (getPlayerLanguage() == MessageLanguage.English) { _sendMessage(message); } _sendMessage(LanguageHandler.translateMessage(message, language)); }

Then you simply have a database to handle the translations. Something like this, maybe:
[table]
[tr][td]
[table][tr][td]languageCode[/td][td]originalMessage[/td][td]translatedMessage[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]es-ES[/td][td]Hello[/td][td]Hello[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]es-ES[/td][td]Welcome to Lumbridge Castle, the home of Duke Horacio.[/td][td]Bienvenidos al Castillo de Lumbridge, la casa del duque Horacio.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table][/td][/tr][/table]

This allows you to provide an easy-to-use and scalable system for multiple languages :)[/quote]

Death Style:

could just keep a 2d array of messages where the second index is the player’s language

Use a unique identifier for each message and have some sort of database/file/whatever that connect the identifier to the localized string.
So “Greetings. Welcome to my castle.” can be replaced with “NPC.dukehuracio.greeting.1” or something similar. With this you’re disconnecting code and language. If you want to fix change anything about what he says, you change the language files where you’ll make the change, and not the code or any other language file. You also avoid problems when 1 to 1 translations of phrases is inaccurate.

If you make a proper system you can make volunteers translate for you. Just provide them with the English language file and they can translate it. However you shouldn’t have two different languages on the same server, so what is the point of having multiple languages?

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Here’s how it works with a SAMP server I worked on a while back.

You send the string like this:

player.sendMessage("Hello"); player.sendMessage("Welcome to Lumbridge Castle, the home of Duke Horacio.");

then in sendMessage you will have something like this:

public void sendMessage(String message) { if (getPlayerLanguage() == MessageLanguage.English) { _sendMessage(message); } _sendMessage(LanguageHandler.translateMessage(message, language)); }

Then you simply have a database to handle the translations. Something like this, maybe:
[table]
[tr][td]
[table][tr][td]languageCode[/td][td]originalMessage[/td][td]translatedMessage[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]es-ES[/td][td]Hello[/td][td]Hello[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]es-ES[/td][td]Welcome to Lumbridge Castle, the home of Duke Horacio.[/td][td]Bienvenidos al Castillo de Lumbridge, la casa del duque Horacio.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table][/td][/tr][/table]

This allows you to provide an easy-to-use and scalable system for multiple languages

Read full topic

item.title: Country's where rsps are played
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

casey.:

I’d go as far to say that the majority of people playing RS can understand English. Don’t waste you’re time on language.

I second this. I saw one RSPS that was in German with like three players and that was probably four years ago. So just stick to English, if someone comes by knowing a language other than English, then they’re probably used to it and have some method of translating it.

Read full topic
